action.action-desc: Mr. Loebsack introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to carry out a grant program for employers to develop and carry out job training programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the New Jobs Training Act.

subsection.text: From the amounts appropriated to carry out this Act, the Secretary of Labor, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, shall award grants to employers to carry out the activities described in subsection (b).

An employer that receives a grant under this section shall use such funds to partner with a community college to create a job training program for the purpose of training individuals for new jobs with the employer.

An employer that desires to receive a grant under this section shall submit an application to the Secretary of Labor at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Secretary may require, which shall include—

paragraph.text: a description of the job training program that the employer seeks to develop and carry out using the grant;
the community college with which the employer plans to partner in developing and carrying out such job training program; and
the number of new jobs the employer seeks to create as a result of such job training program.
The term community college has the meaning given the term junior or community college in section 312 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1058).
The term new job, when used with respect to an employer, means a job that—

subparagraph.text: may include a new position within an existing job category, and is not a job of a recalled worker, a replacement job, or any other job that existed in the employer’s business within the 1-year period preceding the date of hire;

is not a job that existed in a business operation or substantially similar business operation of the employer formerly located in another location which was closed or substantially reduced by the employer; and
results in a net increase in employment for the employer.
